Actually, it didn't produce NPE - it produced IOException, which is correct, 
because it could not finish operation due to the lack of space on the disk. 
Did you expect a different behaviour?

> Did you expect a different behaviour? 

I haven't seen this bug (guess I have big drives) ... but isn't it obvious? 
A nice polite error message and offer to roll-back would be expected ... by me 
at least :)
Which platform is this for? We test for disk space (for Windows and Linux) and update site creators are responsible for setting proper sizes for their features, if they do it this will not happen.

traces.message: There is not enough space on the disk
